content.p: TisNiks is a small collection of Javascript functions for querying the TisVU application. TisVU is an on-line interface for course registration and listing exam results used at the Vrije Universiteit. An example application using TisNiks is BBTis.

TisNiks is meant to be used in Greasemonkey user scripts. It makes use of functionality specific to Greasemonkey, therefore TisNiks is not suitable for use outside of Greasemonkey without some modifications.
Currently, the way to use TisNiks in your Greasemonkey user script is by downloading the code below and copying it to your user script. It has only been tested with Greasemonkey 0.3.3 on Linux.
TisNiks is Open Source and licensed under the new BSD License. This means you can pretty much do with it whatever you like.

Current features of TisNiks are just logging in and out and querying exam results. But TisVU contains more, so TisNiks could be extended. If you have cool ideas for TisNiks, you're welcome to contact me and possibly get write access to the Subversion repository containing TisNiks.
Of course, because TisNiks is free (in every sense), you can also just take the source and extend it on your own.
As a proof-of-concept application of TisNiks, I created the BBTis user script for Greasemonkey. It adds a section to your VU Blackboard homepage listing your latest results from TisVU.
With BBTis installed, your Blackboard will look like this (except for the striped-out grades of course):

To install BBTis, you need Greasemonkey (and for Greasemonkey, you need Firefox). After that, follow the following link to the latest version of BBTis, examine the source to convince yourself I'm not stealing your passwords or anything, and select 'Install User Script' from the 'Tools' menu in Firefox. Accept the default configuration and go to Blackboard.

BBTis can be configured to automatically log in to TisVU (if you're not already). To enable this option, locate the BBTis user script after installation. It will be located in your Firefox profile directory, somewhere deep down like this:
Open the bbtis.user.js file in an editor and adjust the configuration section to your needs.
